title: A Deeper Dive into Wind Waker's Lighting - a Conversation with @Scruffy, part 1

media:group.media:title: A Deeper Dive into Wind Waker's Lighting - a Conversation with @Scruffy, part 1
media:group.media:description:
Part 1 of a conversation I had with @Scruffy, answering some of your questions about noclip.website and The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker.

Please go watch their stuff!
◆ https://www.youtube.com/c/ScruffyMusic/videos
◆ https://twitter.com/Scruffy_Tweets
◆ https://twitter.com/JasperRLZ

Extra Links:
◆ noclip.website ( https://noclip.website )
◆ bmdview.js, my original "alpha" version of noclip.website! ( https://magcius.github.io/bmdview.js/bmdview.html )
◆ zelview.js, another super old tool I made ( https://magcius.github.io/zelview.js/zelview.html )
◆ Winditor, by SageOfMirrors and LordNed ( https://lordned.github.io/Winditor/ )
◆ The official noclip.website Discord Server ( https://discord.gg/bkJmKKv ) 

Timestamps:
00:00 - Introduction
00:58 - How does noclip.website work? How does it render video game maps?
06:48 - What is noclip.website written in?
09:00 - Where did the idea come from?
12:50 - Scruffy shares an anecdote about Pikmin 2 and subsequent level design and storytelling chat
21:40 - In the video on Cel Shading in The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker, how were the visualizations on vertex normals produced?
25:25 - How can a light source exist? Is it an object or a texture, or something else?
33:41 - Why is calculating a vertex normal tricky? Why not use face normals?
38:16 - Is ZAtoon a texture, or is it a look-up table or something like smoothstep?
43:44 - Why not generate palettes via rules but then tweak them manually?
48:03 - How are the palettes combined with Link's tunic?
56:25 - Does the ocean in The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker go on forever? How is it rendered?
1:03:16 - You missed something! They do tone the lighting down in the shadows.
1:08:08 - Thoughts on the HD remaster of The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker?
